STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 17, 2025
Michelle Dykema
Adoption Partners of Michigan
4371 STATE ST,
SAGINAW, MI, 48603-4029
RE: License#: CB730236853
Dear Michelle Dykema:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/16/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not
administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The financial information submitted was a financial statement completed and
reviewed by a CPA firm that indicated the agency is currently in good standing
and maintains compliance with all applicable financial and regulatory
requirements, but it was not adequate to meet the standards required to be
considered an audit consistent with the rule.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator Annual Assessment. No CAP was needed so
there was no review of action steps required. The assessment included an
evaluation/analysis of a disrupted adoption that occurred.
Financial Overview
I reviewed the financial audit/budget. The financial statement review that was
submitted did not meet the requirements of an audit. However, it noted the
agency is in good standing.
Staff Interviews
Staff participated in the entrance conference. Staff interviews did not indicate any
areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely and there is a cross
shredder for CHRI.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
“This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services, therefore this is not applicable”.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_____________________________________07/15/2025
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 17, 2025
